details:
It was discovered that there was a a remote code execution vulnerability in
[Mumble](https://www.mumble.info/), a VoIP client commonly used for
group chats. The exploit could have been been triggered by a maliciously
crafted URL on the server list.


* [CVE-2021-27229](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2021-27229)
Mumble before 1.3.4 allows remote code execution if a victim navigates
 to a crafted URL on a server list and clicks on the Open Webpage
 text.


For Debian 9 Stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
1.2.18-1+deb9u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your mumble packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
